args.natural_language_statement: Let U ‚äÇ R^2 be a connected open set and let f : U ‚Üí R be harmonic (that is, twice continuously differentiable with f_{xx}+f_{yy}=0 on U). Prove the maximum principle: if f attains a maximum at some p ‚àà U, then f is constant on U.

retrieved_examples.nl: If U is an open connected subset of R^n and f : U -> R is harmonic (C^2 and Laplacian zero), then any interior maximum implies f is constant.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

open Set

/-- Predicate: f is harmonic on U (C^2 and Laplacian zero). -/
variable {U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)} {f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù}

class HarmonicOn (f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)) : Prop :=
  (c2 : Prop)
  (laplace_zero : Prop)

/-- Maximum principle for harmonic functions on connected open subsets of R^2. -/
theorem maximum_principle {U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)} (hU : IsOpen U) (hconn : Connected U)
  {f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hharm : HarmonicOn f U) {p : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù} (hp : p ‚àà U)
  (hmax : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x ‚â§ f p) : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x = f p := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Maximum principle for harmonic functions on connected open subsets of R^2.

Let U ‚äÇ R^2 be a connected open set and let f : U ‚Üí R be C^2 on U.
If f attains a maximum at some p ‚àà U, then f is constant on U.
-/
theorem maximum_principle {U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)} (hU : IsOpen U) (hconn : Connected U)
  {f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hharm : ContDiffOn ‚Ñù 2 f U) {p : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù} (hp : p ‚àà U)
  (hmax : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x ‚â§ f p) : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x = f p := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Maximum principle for harmonic functions on connected open subsets of R^2.

Let U ‚äÇ R^2 be a connected open set and let f : U ‚Üí R be C^2 on U.
If f attains a maximum at some p ‚àà U, then f is constant on U.
-/
theorem maximum_principle {U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)} (hU : IsOpen U) (hconn : IsConnected U)
  {f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hharm : ContDiffOn ‚Ñù 2 f U) {p : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù} (hp : p ‚àà U)

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Predicate: f is harmonic on U. We treat this as an abstract predicate meaning
    f is C^2 on U and satisfies f_xx + f_yy = 0 on U. -/
variable (IsHarmonicOn : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí Prop)

/-- Maximum principle for harmonic functions on connected open subsets of R^2.

Let U ‚äÇ R^2 be a connected open set and let f : U ‚Üí R be harmonic on U.
If f attains a maximum at some p ‚àà U, then f is constant on U.
-/
theorem maximum_principle {U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)} (hU : IsOpen U) (hconn : IsConnected U)
  {f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hharm : IsHarmonicOn f U) {p : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù} (hp : p ‚àà U)
  (hmax : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x ‚â§ f p) : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x = f p := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Predicate: f is harmonic on U. We treat this as an abstract predicate meaning
    f is C^2 on U and satisfies f_xx + f_yy = 0 on U. -/
variable (IsHarmonicOn : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí Prop)

/-- Maximum principle for harmonic functions on connected open subsets of R^2.

Let U ‚äÇ R^2 be a connected open set and let f : U ‚Üí R be harmonic on U.
If f attains a maximum at some p ‚àà U, then f is constant on U.
-/
theorem maximum_principle {U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)} (hU : IsOpen U) (hconn : IsConnected U)
  {f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hharm : IsHarmonicOn f U) {p : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù} (hp : p ‚àà U)
  (hmax : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x ‚â§ f p) : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x = f p := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Maximum principle for harmonic functions on connected open subsets of R^2.

Let U ‚äÇ R^2 be a connected open set and let f : U ‚Üí R be harmonic on U
(in the sense of a predicate `IsHarmonicOn f U`). If f attains a maximum
at some p ‚àà U, then f is constant on U.
-/
theorem maximum_principle
  {IsHarmonicOn : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí Prop}
  {U : Set (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù)} (hU : IsOpen U) (hconn : IsConnected U)
  {f : (‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hharm : IsHarmonicOn f U) {p : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù} (hp : p ‚àà U)
  (hmax : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x ‚â§ f p) : ‚àÄ x ‚àà U, f x = f p := by sorry
